concise_definition: n. 评估, 评价, 鉴定

definitions.explanation_en: The systematic process of assessing the quality, significance, or value of something, often based on defined criteria or standards.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指依据明确的标准或准则，对某事物的质量、重要性或价值进行系统性评估的过程。
definitions.example_en: The teacher provided detailed evaluations of each student's performance at the end of the semester.
definitions.example_cn: 学期末，老师对每位学生的表现进行了详细的评估。

definitions.explanation_en: An opinion or judgment formed after careful consideration, often used in professional, academic, or personal contexts to determine effectiveness or suitability.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指经过仔细思考后形成的判断或意见，常用于专业、学术或个人情境中，以确定某事物的有效性或适用性。
definitions.example_en: Her evaluations of the new policy were largely positive, citing improved efficiency and employee satisfaction.
definitions.example_cn: 她对这项新政策的评价总体积极，指出其提高了效率并增强了员工满意度。

definitions.explanation_en: The result or outcome of an assessment, such as a grade, score, or written report summarizing findings.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指评估的结果，如成绩、分数或总结发现的书面报告。
definitions.example_en: The final evaluations were posted on the portal for all participants to review.
definitions.example_cn: 最终的评估结果已发布在门户网站上，供所有参与者查阅。

comparison.analysis: “Assessment”（评估）与 “evaluation” 非常接近，常可互换，但 “assessment” 更侧重于收集信息和判断现状，常用于教育、医疗或风险分析领域，强调过程的客观性；而 “evaluation” 更强调基于标准做出价值判断，带有更强的结论性和决策导向。
“Appraisal”（鉴定、评价）通常用于对人或物的经济价值、能力或表现进行正式评价，尤其在人力资源（如绩效考核）或房地产领域使用频繁。它比 “evaluation” 更具正式性和权威性，常由专家或权威机构执行。
“Review”（审查、回顾）指对已有内容进行重新检查或总结，可能不包含价值判断，仅是复盘或整理。例如，文献综述或项目回顾。而 “evaluation” 必然包含判断和结论，是更深入、更具批判性的分析行为。
